snippet: Sgt. First Class Charles Martland faces discharge after he helped to beat up an Afghan militia commander who kept a boy chained to his bed as a sex slave.
abstract: Lawmakers urge Defense Dept to reinstate Army sergeant Charles Martland, who violently reprimanded Afghan militia commander who raped boy; want to end bureaucratic debate over whether American soldiers can be punished for intervening in child sex abuse by Afghan forces, and intend to introduce legislation encouraging such action.
lead_paragraph: Sgt. First Class Charles Martland faces discharge after he helped to beat up an Afghan militia commander who kept a boy chained to his bed as a sex slave.

headline.main: Green Beret Who Hit Afghan Child Rapist Should Be Reinstated, Lawmakers Say
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Seek to Save Soldier’s Job

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
